asset.description: Unique identifier with the name of the asset.

capacity.description: Capacity for one unit of the asset (is therefore multiplied by number of existing plus number of invested assets).

consumer_balance_sense.description: Is the sense of the consumer balance constraint, equal to, greater than or less than.

discount_rate.description: e.g. 0.05 is 5 %. discount rate for the annuity calculation.

economic_lifetime.description: Economic lifetime of the unit for annuity calculation.

energy_to_power_ratio.description: Fixed ratio between the energy storage capacity [MWh] and the discharge/charge capacity [MW] for energy storage investments where `storage_method_energy = false`.

group.description: Group to which the asset belongs to (null/empty/missing -> no group).

investment_integer.description: Whether investment decisions are using integer variables.

investment_integer_storage_energy.description: Whether investment for storage energy is integer or continuous. It only applies for energy storage investments where `storage_method_energy = true`.

is_seasonal.description: Whether seasonal storage (e.g., hydro) or not (e.g., battery)

max_ramp_down.description: Maximum ramping down rate as a portion of the capacity of asset.

max_ramp_up.description: Maximum ramping up rate as a portion of the capacity of asset.

min_operating_point.description: Minimum operating point or minimum stable generation level defined as a portion of the capacity of asset.

ramping.description: Whether asset has ramping constraints or not.

storage_method_energy.description: Whether there is independent investment on storage capacity or not. If false, the investment on storage capacity uses the energy_to_power_ratio as a constant fixed value.

technical_lifetime.description: Technical lifetime of the unit to determine for how long the capacity is considered from the commission year.

unit_commitment.description: Whether asset has unit commitment constraints or not

unit_commitment_integer.description: Whether the unit commitment variables are integer or not.

unit_commitment_method.description: Which unit commitment method to use (null/empty/missing -> no unit commitment method).

use_binary_storage_method.description: Whether to use an extra binary variable for the storage assets to avoid charging and discharging simultaneously (null/empty/missing -> no binary).

asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

decommissionable.description: Whether or not the asset can be decommissioned.

milestone_year.description: Year of investment and operation decisions in the optimization.

asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

fixed_cost.description: Fixed annual cost for the asset capacity.

fixed_cost_storage_energy.description: Fixed annual cost for the asset storage capacity

investment_cost.description: Investment cost for the asset capacity.

investment_cost_storage_energy.description: Investment cost for the asset energy storage capacity.

investment_limit.description: Maximum capacity for the asset investment. If the initial value is null, empty, or missing, it will be no limit.

investment_limit_storage_energy.description: Maximum capacity for the asset storage investment. If the initial value is null, empty, or missing, it will be no limit.

storage_loss_from_stored_energy.description: [e.g. 0.01 means 1% every hour] Loss of stored energy over time.

asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

initial_storage_level.description: The initial storage level at the beginning of the optimization. The final storage level needs to be above this initial value. If the initial value is null, empty, or missing, it will be optimized using a cycling constraint that links the last period to the initial period.

investable.description: Whether there is an investment variable created for the asset or not.

max_energy_timeframe_partition.description: The maximum amount of energy across the timeframe (e.g., a year) that the asset must produce. If the initial value is null, empty, or missing, it will be no limit.

milestone_year.description: Year of investment and operation decisions in the optimization.

min_energy_timeframe_partition.description: The minimum amount of energy across the timeframe (e.g., a year) that the asset must produce. If the initial value is null, empty, or missing, it will be no limit.

peak_demand.description: Value that multiplies the demand profile time series.

storage_inflows.description: Value that multiplies the inflow profile time series.

units_on_cost.description: Cost of keeping unit online for one hour or the objective function coefficient on `units_on` variable. e.g., no_load cost or idling cost

asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

profile_name.description: Name of profile, used to determine data inside the DuckDB table

profile_type.description: Type of profile, used to determine DuckDB table with source profile

asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

partition.description: Partition or temporal resolution in the representative periods. For example, for a `uniform` specification `1` is hourly, `2` is every two hours.

specification.description: Partition (or temporal resolution) specification in the representative periods.

asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

partition.description: Partition or temporal resolution in the timeframe. For example, if a period is equivalent to a day then for a `uniform` specification `1` is per day, `2` is every two days.

specification.description: Partition (or temporal resolution) specification in the timeframe.

asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

profile_name.description: Name of profile, used to determine data inside the DuckDB table

profile_type.description: Type of profile, used to determine DuckDB table with source profile

capacity.description: Capacity for one unit of the transport flow (is therefore multiplied by number of existing plus invested number of transport assets).

discount_rate.description: e.g. 0.05 is 5 %. discount rate for the annuity calculation.

economic_lifetime.description: Economic lifetime of the transport asset for annuity calculation.

from_asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

investment_integer.description: Whether investment decisions are using integer variables.

is_transport.description: Whether a transport flow or not. Transport assets can have flows in both directions and can be invested in.

technical_lifetime.description: Technical lifetime of the transport asset to determine for how long the capacity is considered from the commission year.

to_asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

decommissionable.description: Whether the transport asset can be decomission or not.

from_asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

initial_export_units.description: Number of existing units in `from_asset` -> `to_asset` direction

initial_import_units.description: Number of existing units in `to_asset` -> `from_asset` direction

milestone_year.description: Year of investment and operation decisions in the optimization.

to_asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

fixed_cost.description: Fixed annual cost for the transport asset capacity.

flow_coefficient_in_capacity_constraint.description: Coefficient for the flow in the maximum capacity constraints.

from_asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

investment_cost.description: Investment cost for the transport asset capacity.

investment_limit.description: Maximum capacity for the transport asset investment. If the initial value is null, empty, or missing, it will be no limit.

to_asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

from_asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

investable.description: Whether there is an investment variable created for the asset or not.

milestone_year.description: Year of investment and operation decisions in the optimization.

to_asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

from_asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

profile_name.description: Name of profile, used to determine data inside the DuckDB table

profile_type.description: Type of profile, used to determine DuckDB table with source profile

to_asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

constant.description: Constant `C` in `flow_1 {==;>=;<=} C + A x flow_2` relationship constraint

flow_1_from_asset.description: Name of the `from_asset` of the `flow_1` in `flow_1 {==;>=;<=} C + A x flow_2` relationship constraint. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

flow_1_to_asset.description: Name of the `to_asset` of the `flow_1` in `flow_1 {==;>=;<=} C + A x flow_2` relationship constraint. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

flow_2_from_asset.description: Name of the `from_asset` of the `flow_2` in `flow_1 {==;>=;<=} C + A x flow_2` relationship constraint. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

flow_2_to_asset.description: Name of the `to_asset` of the `flow_2` in `flow_1 {==;>=;<=} C + A x flow_2` relationship constraint. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

ratio.description: Ratio `A` in `flow_1 {==;>=;<=} C + A x flow_2` relationship constraint

sense.description: Is the sense in `flow_1 {==;>=;<=} C + A x flow_2` relationship constraint, equal to, greater than or less than.

from_asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

partition.description: Partition or temporal resolution in the representative periods. For example, for a `uniform` specification `1` is hourly, `2` is every two hours.

specification.description: Partition (or temporal resolution) specification in the representative periods.

to_asset.description: Name of the asset. Same as the one in the `asset` table.

invest_method.description: true -> activate group constraints; false -> no group investment constraints

milestone_year.description: Year of investment and operation decisions in the optimization.

num_timesteps.description: Number of timesteps of the representative period.

is_milestone.description: Whether the year is a milestone year or a vintage year

length.description: How many hours in a year, e.g., 8760
